p: As regarding flavonoids, a class of secondary plant metabolites with powerful antioxidant activity [ 33], myricetin and myricetin-3- O-rhamnoside were most abundant compounds followed by the quercetin and its derivates. These results are in agreement with those reported by Barboni et al . [ 32] who studied the chemical composition of myrtle berry extracts by LC–MS/MS and HPLC–DAD and showed that myricetin and glycosides derivates were the major constituents.
